thread.title: New York Red Bulls slammed after 'classless' tweet mocking Frank Lampard following Chelsea legend's retirement
thread.title_full: New York Red Bulls slammed after 'classless' tweet mocking Frank Lampard following Chelsea legend's retirement

author: James Whaling
title: New York Red Bulls slammed after 'classless' tweet mocking Frank Lampard following Chelsea legend's retirement

organizations.name: invalid email  new york red bulls

text:
Sport New York Red Bulls slammed after 'classless' tweet mocking Frank Lampard following Chelsea legend's retirement Lampard played for Red Bulls' local rivals New York City and the MLS side posted a GIF of the former England midfielder being nutmegged Share Lampard during his time with NYCFC (Photo: GETTY) Share Get Chelsea FC updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
New York Red Bulls have been slammed for their 'classless' tweet mocking Frank Lampard following the Chelsea legend announcing his retirement from football. 
The former England midfielder called time on his playing career on Thursday after opting not to sign for a new club in the January window. 
Lampard finished his days on the pitch with Red Bulls' local rivals New York City FC, and the MLS side couldn't resist a cheeky dig at the ex-Manchester City man. 
They posted a tweet simply reading 'bye' with an accompanying GIF of Lampard being nutmegged in Red Bulls' 7-0 win over NYCFC in last season's Hudson River derby. Lampard finished his career in the Big Apple (Photo: Getty Images) The former Chelsea midfielder with NYCFC teammate David Villa (Photo: Getty Images) Read More Harry Redknapp opens up about THAT infamous Frank Lampard moment - 'I knew he'd reach the very top' 
Lampard failed to hit the heights in the US he did on English shores, but earned worldwide acclaim from big names across football on the day he announced he was hanging up his boots. 
The 38-year-old won three Premier League titles, four FA Cups, two League Cups, the Europa League and the Champions League during his trophy-laden spell at Stamford Bridge. 
He also became the Blues' record goal scorer and the fourth-highest in Premier League history, despite playing in midfield. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
